tool.name: Mummer

param.name: anchoring
param.label: Match anchoring strategy
param.option: Maximal matches unique in only reference sequence (Default)
Ma ximal matches unique in both sequences

param.name: direction
param.label: Direction of complement sequence to use
param.option: Compute forward and reverse complement matches

param.name: force
param.label: Force 4 column output
param.help: force 4 column output format regardless of the number of reference sequence inputs

param.name: chars
param.label: Match only the characters a, c, g, or t

param.name: print_length
param.label: Print length of query sequence in header of matches

param.name: print_53
param.label: Print first 53 characters of the matching substring

param.name: position
param.label: Report the query position of a reverse complement match relative to the forward strand of the query sequence

param.name: threads
param.label: Number of threads to use for -maxmatch
param.help: only valid if above parameter is greater than one

param.name: qthreads
param.label: Number of threads to use for queries

param.name: suflink
param.label: Use suffix links in the index and during search?

param.name: child
param.label: Use child table in the index and during search?

param.name: skip
param.label: Sparsify
param.help: Sparsify the MEM-finding algorithm even more, performing jumps of skip*k [auto (l-10)/k]

param.name: kmer
param.label: kmer table
param.help: Use kmer table containing sa-intervals (speeds up searching first k characters) in the index and during search

tool.help: This is the core program of the MUMmer package. It is the suffix-tree based match finding routine, and the main part of every MUMmer script. For a detailed manual describing how to use this program, please refer to "docs/maxmat3man.pdf" or in LaTeX format "docs/maxmat3man.tex". By default, mummer now finds maximal matches regardless of their uniqueness. Limiting the output to only unique matches can be specified as a command line switch.
